bug.author: Xeratec
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>Versions</denchmark-h>
Weights and Biases version: 0.9.0 Python version: 3.7.7 Operating System: Windows 10 Home Jupyter Lab: jupyter-client: 6.1.3 jupyter-console: 6.1.0 jupyter-core: 4.6.3 jupiter: 1.0.0 jupyterlab-server: 1.1.4 jupyterlab: 1.2.6
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
I am working with Jupyter Lab. I enabled code saving in my personal account and it does upload the code successfully to the code folder. The problem is that the path in the config.yaml has a backslash instead of a forward slash. wandb_version: 1
_wandb: desc: null value: cli_version: 0.9.0 is_jupyter_run: true is_kaggle_kernel: false python_version: 3.7.7 session_history: code\_session_history.ipynb test: desc: null value: true I am not able to change the path as it gets reset as soon as I rerun the commands below. Because of this error, I get a error when clicking on the code icon inside the run on <denchmark-link:http://www.app.wandb.ai>www.app.wandb.ai</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
import wandb
defaults=dict( test = True, )
wandb.init(project="test", config=defaults)
for i in range(10): sleep(0.1) print(i) wandb.log({"epoch": i/10})

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.65. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Xeratec>@Xeratec</denchmark-link> this should be fixed in our new cli library . If you'd like to try it now you can do you can find more information here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wandb/client-ng>https://github.com/wandb/client-ng</denchmark-link>
